intro: Palicourea ianthina, commonly known as blue-eyed palicourea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to blue, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Palicourea ianthina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
